channel.title: Programming For Everyone. Java, Perl, Python, PHP, HTML & More [Mammoth Topic]
channel.description:
Last Updated: 19th December @ 12:08AM. Firstly, I'd like to begin with a [s]small[/s] medium sized introduction:
[b][u][size=4]Introduction[/b] I registered to these forums a little under 2 weeks ago, I'd been browsing for a couple of years but decided it was time to join.
I've gotta say, MoparScape is where it's at! There's actually a great number of intelligent and talented people here (you just got to know where to look) and it's been quite aspiring to read some of the content I've read.
I've been thinking about what to do. I've been browsing for years, soaking up all the information and realised there's more to gain than just good/bad programming habits and the basic Java know-how.
There's great potential in all of us, we just need help finding that feeling inside that says: "Today, I'm going to create something beautiful."
There's more to be fulfilled in everyones hunger for making the best RSPS; for making other sorts of programs and codes that could aid us prior to going to the RSPS section, and it's then I thought I wanted to give something back to the community.
[b][u][size=4]What I'd Like To Share[/b] A vast libary of knowledge, from a beginner to a compotent programmer. Everything I've collected over the years that would turn a nobody into a somebody. A sweet concoction of .PDF's, .(M)HTML's and Documents.
[b][u][size=4]Something For Everyone[/b] Delve into the awesome world of programming:
[ul][li]Java[/li] [li]Shell Coding[/li] [li]Perl[/li] [li]HTML[/li] [li]Internet Programming[/li] [li]Windows Programming[/li] [li]Unix[/li] [li]PHP[/li] [li]C/C++[/li] [li]Python[/li] [li]Batch File[/li] [li]Assembly[/li] [li]and more...[/li][/ul]
Here's my collection: [URL=http://img517.imageshack.us/i/153mb.png/][IMG]http://img517.imageshack.us/img517/2027/153mb.png[/img][/URL]
But I won't be uploading that much...
[b][u][size=4]Java PDF File[/b] I can't open .PDF files at the moment because I don't have Adobe Reader (no I won't download), so here's some Java PDF's I've yet to read:
[b]1000 Java Tips (8.53MB): http://www.mediafire.com/?s27vc12yhb17sbb [b]Sams Teach Yourself Java 6 In 21 Days (6.25MB): http://www.mediafire.com/?5vme5r3h9t8g1l5 [b]Absolute Java (5.33MB): http://www.mediafire.com/?4g9gmugbemi4bdu
[b][u][size=4]Java (M)HTML File[/b] [b]Bleeding From The Keyboard (230.99KB): http://www.mediafire.com/?zxdwd60jzsommit ^Consists of 20 MHTML Documents, all labelled from 0 - 20. A very [i]different[/i] approach for beginning in Java. Contains networking, design patterns, the basics to get you started and more - worth the read.
[b]InformIT (2.17MB): http://www.mediafire.com/?07mngtuaan2nryt ^Consists of 29 files, varying slightly from "Bleeding From The Keyboard". Probably a better yet a tad more advanced that "Bleeding From The Keyboard", nevertheless very insightful for an ambitious novice with a little bit of knowledge.
[b]Miscellaneous Package 1 (868KB): http://www.mediafire.com/?83cw46m6whowscv ^Consists of 22 files:
[ul][li]4 Simple Rules For Effective Bug-Free Concurrent Programming[/li] [li]A Java Tutorial[/li] [li]Arrays[/li] [li]Binary Compatibility[/li] [li]Blocks and Statements[/li] [li]Classes[/li] [li]Conversions and Promotions[/li] [li]Definite Assignment[/li] [li]Exceptions[/li] [li]Execution[/li] [li]Expressions[/li] [li]Garbage Collection and the Other Kind of Heap[/li] [li]Grammars[/li] [li]Interfaces[/li] [li]Introduction[/li] [li]Big Integer Class[/li] [li]Lexical Structure[/li] [li]Names[/li] [li]Packages[/li] [li]Syntax[/li] [li]Threads and Locks[/li] [li]Types, Values and Variables[/li][/ul]
[b]Miscellaneous Package 3 (6.15MB): http://www.mediafire.com/?1dp5jlwy181wjab ^Consists of 3 files:
[ul][li]Developing Games in Java 2003[/li] [li]Getting Started with Java Programming! Mega[/li] [li]Java Methods and Uses[/li][/ul]
[b]Killer Game Programming in Java 2005 (12.65MB): http://www.mediafire.com/?a3mffon7g2y26x3 ^This really is killer. I highly reccommend this as it teaches 2D and 3D GameEngines, fullscreening, visual effects, sound implementation, sprites, loading and manipulating models, animated 3D sprites, bullet path-making, terrain generation, tree's that grow, networking, installation and alot more! Must have for anyone who's interested.
[b][u][size=4]Shell Coding [color=blue]Document File[/b] [b]Advanced Shell Coding Techniques (3.06KB):[/b] http://www.mediafire.com/?389uy177azgpne7 ^Interesting yet complicated read (at least for me). Contains reference to mul, div and leal showing how you can use and understand the more inner workings of a computer. For intermediate and expert programmers.
[b][u][size=4]Perl [color=orange]HTML File[/b] [b]Introduction to Perl (63KB): http://www.mediafire.com/?50aal0p4zjddo3s ^Want to learn Perl? This is a very good way to go about if you're interested in learning Perl. Clear and concise HTML files, easy to read and understand.
[b]Flat Databases in Perl (9KB): http://www.mediafire.com/?zr34jcsap263brn [b]Escape Quotes in Perl Shell (3.22KB): http://www.mediafire.com/?0sdc46nydsbcmzy
[b][u][size=4]HTML [color=orange]HTML File[/b] [b]Welcome To The HTML Tutorial (35.63KB): http://www.mediafire.com/?71xbxtdla3w7zvr ^Consists of 11 lessons. I have personally used this and it is more than worthy as far as HTML tutorials go.
I now know how to begin a HTML document, using tags such as; HTML, BODY, H1, FONT, COLOR and BLOCKQUOTE. I can also link pages, create tables and cells, lists, background images, embed media, format a page into parts etc. so this is just a taster of what it offers. Reccommended for beginners.
[b][u][size=4]Internet Programming [color=orange]HTML File[/b] [b]Windows Internet Programming Part 1, 2 and 3 (56.43KB): http://www.mediafire.com/?3he6ke33mnl52td ^Consists of 3 files. This is mammoth documentation on its own. Explaining in great detail about how TCP/UDP works, sending email via code, POP3. There's so much I'm not going to write it down. It's all about the internet. Reccommended for advanced programmers.
[b][u][size=4]Windows Programming [color=orange]HTML File[/b] [b]Windows Programming Tutorial (782.68KB): http://www.mediafire.com/?xh11agrihrx9xs5 ^Consists of:
[URL=http://img7.imageshack.us/i/contentsx.png/][IMG]http://img7.imageshack.us/img7/4901/contentsx.png[/img][/URL]
All about creating GUI, windows and pop-up boxes from your desktop. All you need is NotePad and this great HTML Document and you're away in no time.
[b][u][size=4]Unix [color=orange]HTML[/b] [b]Basic C Socket Programming in Unix For Newbies (6.89KB): http://www.mediafire.com/?a1cp7ncjuc3sti0 [b]Unix (75KB): http://www.mediafire.com/?rbii68yi8mlxkhj ^Consists of 8 HTML Documents and 3 text files.
[ul][li]Linux[/li] [li]LinuxHDTweak[/li] [li]Shell[/li] [li]TCPWrappers[/li] [li]WinModem[/li] [li]etc[/li] [li]LinuxGames[/li] [li]UnixSec[/li] [li]2038-Time-Bug[/li] [li]LinuxNet[/li] [li]SlackCS[/li][/ul]
[b][u][size=4]PHP [color=orange]HTML[/b] [b]Creating a Simple Hit Counter in PHP (3.13KB): http://www.mediafire.com/?1a91oxlgn2cqgu1 [b]Creating a Simple Search Engine in PHP (3.43KB): http://www.mediafire.com/?s93et4lk9va1vuo [b]Using Databases in PHP (11.72KB): http://www.mediafire.com/?vye1vo145ptwpm2
[b][u][size=4]C/C++ [color=orange]HTML[/b] [b]Thinking In C++ 2nd Edition: http://www.oopweb.com/CPP/Documents/ThinkingInCpp2/VolumeFrames.html
[b]C and C++ (13.95KB): http://www.mediafire.com/?mhtsapf7xaoj290 ^ Consists of 2 files. "[b]The C Programming Language Torn Apart[/b]" and "[b]C++ Tutorial[/b]".
"[b]The C Programming Language Torn Apart[/b]" contains some of the basic and intermediate syntax.
"[b]C++ Tutorial[/b]" contains abit more:
[i] [ul][li][b]1.[/b] Introduction[/li]
[li][b]1.1.[/b] Why do people program?[/li] [li][b]1.2.[/b] What is C++ & OOP?[/li] [li][b]1.3.[/b] What do I need to program?[/li]
[li][b]2.0.[/b] Your first program[/li]
[li][b]2.1.[/b] Running a C++ program[/li] [li][b]2.2.[/b] C++ program structure[/li] [li][b]2.3.[/b] Comments[/li] [li][b]2.4.[/b] Libraries[/li] [li][b]2.5.[/b] Functions[/li] [li][b]2.6.[/b] Streams[/li] [li][b]2.7.[/b] Return[/li]
[li][b]3.0.[/b] Number Systems[/li]
[li][b]3.1.[/b] Decimals[/li] [li][b]3.2.[/b] Binaries[/li] [li][b]3.3.[/b] Hexadecimals[/li]
[li][b]4.0.[/b] Exercises[/li]
[li][b]4.1.[/b] EX 1 : Running[/li] [li][b]4.2.[/b] EX 2 : Typing[/li] [li][b]4.3.[/b] EX 3 : Converting[/li]
[li][b]5.0.[/b] What now?[/li]
[li][b]5.1.[/b] Good programming sites[/li] [li][b]5.2.[/b] Good books on C++[/li][/ul]
[i]Both are good for beginners and intermediates wanting to start out or use for reference.[/i]
[b][u][size=4]Visual Basics [/b]PDF/CHM [b]My Visual Basic eBook Collection - BrO_AcT (Just under 1GB): http://uploading.com/files/O7ACUYF2/VBeBooks.part01.rar.html http://uploading.com/files/UZ0ZHANZ/VBeBooks.part02.rar.html http://uploading.com/files/NLAF0JI7/VBeBooks.part03.rar.html http://uploading.com/files/912BR5TM/VBeBooks.part04.rar.html http://uploading.com/files/UJ3KE2XY/VBeBooks.part05.rar.html http://uploading.com/files/Z950MLPL/VBeBooks.part06.rar.html http://uploading.com/files/HFC09DR3/VBeBooks.part07.rar.html http://uploading.com/files/8YP1VMD0/VBeBooks.part08.rar.html http://uploading.com/files/ZLUSRAG2/VBeBooks.part09.rar.html ^Not my links. Good for anyone with an interest in VB. Credits go to "BrO_AcT" of HF.
[code] My Visual Basic eBook Collection - BrO_AcT
A programmers introduction to VB.NET 2001.pdf

[b]Visual Basic 6.0 Enterprise Edition [Full + Cracked] (303.88MB): http://www.megaupload.com/?d=SHOR71RT ^Not my link. Credits go to "tak3n" of HF. This is a cracked application of the Visual Basics 6.0 Enterprise (meaning it's the full paid version; free for you). If anyone has more information regarding this that would be great as I don't know much about the application, nor do I have it downloaded. Just providing the link.

item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“EcoPS GM, post:126, topic:370117”]These are simple things, perhaps besides the post modifications. You can delete an account without deleting the posts, unless that was rewritten as well.

And see - that would be less of an extreme, your suggestion for modifying old posts. I don’t even really see what’s so bad about old members deleting their old posts. If you wanted to keep it so bad, save a copy of said post.[/quote]
What’s the point of deleting your account if the posts doesn’t get deleted? Letting people delete their accounts/posts isn’t going to bring more members in, as they wouldn’t have those concerns unless they’ll leave us.

Read full topic

item.title: Programming For Everyone. Java, Perl, Python, PHP, HTML & More [Mammoth Topic]
item.dc:creator: @my-swagger my-swagger
item.description:
@my-swagger wrote:

Dunno maybe they do what they do due to certain limitations?

If you care so much go look at the repo and fix what you think is broken or write mods that will actually benefit us. If you can’t, stop complaining.

For example: Deleting accounts. A good solution would be to make the account inactive and maybe have that as a visible status on posts but not allow the profile to be visible?

Modifying posts: sure mitb wants to preserve posts and stop people removing them. A viable solution would be have an old post need approval by a mod or something. Me personally idc, shouldn’t have written it if you’re going to regret writing it.

Ofc somebody is going to need to write an implementation for this and the community would need to have a mutual acceptance for stuff to happen. (Although this is sometimes ignored)

Read full topic

item.title: Programming For Everyone. Java, Perl, Python, PHP, HTML & More [Mammoth Topic]
item.dc:creator: @EcoPS_GM EcoPS GM
item.description:
@EcoPS_GM wrote:

Kind of hard not to. I mean, I don’t see any reason behind doing that. A blind man could tell this site has problems. My first impression here was the community was the reason this site was dying, however after seeing how this site is ran - I may start to think otherwise. I’m not saying the administration is of poor quality, just some of the actions the staff takes, some standard features being removed, and just being bland in general. This site tries to be logical, yet there is a point where you may be thinking too logically about things.

Read full topic

item.title: Programming For Everyone. Java, Perl, Python, PHP, HTML & More [Mammoth Topic]
item.dc:creator: @my-swagger my-swagger
item.description:
@my-swagger wrote:

EcoPS GM:

item.title: Programming For Everyone. Java, Perl, Python, PHP, HTML & More [Mammoth Topic]
item.dc:creator: @my-swagger my-swagger
item.description:
@my-swagger wrote:

Some of these might be the wrong pdf or a link to an updated version to original OP.
The unavailable ones can be requested althugh I’m not too sure if they can be aquired to either being unavailable to vauge naming.

As a side note: There are much better resources now available online that cover what’s here in much better detail.

[spoiler]##Java
1000 Java Tips
http://read.pudn.com/downloads160/ebook/721947/1000%20Java%20Tips/1000%20Java%20Tips.pdf

Sams Teach Yourself Java 6 In 21 Days
http://portal.aauj.edu/e_books/teach_your_self_java_in_21_days.pdf

Absolute Java

Wow! eBook

Absolute Java, 5th Edition

Praised for providing an engaging balance of thoughtful examples and explanatory discussion, best-selling author Walt Savitchs explain concepts and techniq...

Bleeding From The Keyboard
http://www.roxie.org/books/bleeding/tableofcontents.html

InformIt
unavailable

Miscellaneous Package
unavailable

Miscellaneous Package 3
unavailable

Killer Game Programming in Java 2005
http://www.reedbushey.com/106Killer%20Game%20Programming%20in%20Java.pdf

##Shell Coding
Advanced Shell Coding Techniques
unavailable

##Perl
Introduction to Perl

ncnr.nist.gov

PerlIntroNotes.pdf

74.92 KB

Flat Databases in Perl
unavailable

Escape Quotes in Perl Shell
unavailable

##HTML
Welcome To The HTML Tutorial
unavailable

##Internet Programming
Windows Internet Programming Part 1, 2 and 3
http://slav0nic.org.ua/static/books/C_Cpp/Windows%20Internet%20Programming%20Part%201.htm
http://slav0nic.org.ua/static/books/C_Cpp/Windows%20Internet%20Programming%20Part%202.htm
http://slav0nic.org.ua/static/books/C_Cpp/Windows%20Internet%20Programming%20Part%203.htm

##Windows Programming
http://read.pudn.com/downloads66/ebook/238647/Programming%20Windows%20Fifth%20Edition.pdf

##Unix
Basic C Socket Programming in Unix For Newbies
http://www.ro.feri.uni-mb.si/predmeti/avt_pro_ob/lab_vaje/c_sockets.txt

Unix
unavailable

##PHP
Creating a Simple Hit Counter in PHP
http://quicksilver.be.washington.edu/courses/arch482/handouts.invis/Hit%20Counter%20Tutorial.pdf

Creating a Simple Search Engine in PHP

dmxzone.com

BuildPHPSearchEngine.pdf

141.44 KB

Using Databases in PHP
unavailable

##C/C++
Thinking In C++ 2nd Edition
http://www.digilife.be/quickreferences/books/thinking%20in%20c++,%20volume%201,%202nd%20edition.pdf
http://www.hep.phy.cam.ac.uk/TIC2Vtwo.pdf

The C Programming Language Torn Apart
http://www.moatebook.org/files/2hh0id_torn-apart-basic-.pdf

C++ Tutorial
http://www.cplusplus.com/files/tutorial.pdf

##Visual Basics PDF/CHM
unavailable[/spoiler]

Let’s resticky.
